body_html:
Good call!

$ gcc -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE '-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1' -fstack-protector -fPIE -Wall -Wunused-but-set-parameter -Wno-free-nonheap-object -fno-omit-frame-pointer -g0 -O2 -DNDEBUG -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -DGPR_BACKWARDS_COMPATIBILITY_MODE '-std=c99' -MD -MF -c test.c 
test.c: In function ‘main’:
test.c:9:14: error: ‘S_IREAD’ undeclared (first use in this function)
 FileHandle = S_IREAD;
              ^
test.c:9:14: note: each undeclared identifier is reported only once for each function it appears in
test.c:11:14: error: ‘S_IWRITE’ undeclared (first use in this function)
 FileHandle = S_IWRITE;
              ^

However, the toy example compiles fine if I remove the c99 option.

I'm now attempting to build the pip wheel using the following command (stripped off the extra arguments that previous users indicated would prevent certain error messages):

$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --verbose_failures //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

I'll post an update tomorrow.

body:
Good call!

```
$ gcc -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE '-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1' -fstack-protector -fPIE -Wall -Wunused-but-set-parameter -Wno-free-nonheap-object -fno-omit-frame-pointer -g0 -O2 -DNDEBUG -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -DGPR_BACKWARDS_COMPATIBILITY_MODE '-std=c99' -MD -MF -c test.c 
test.c: In function ‘main’:
test.c:9:14: error: ‘S_IREAD’ undeclared (first use in this function)
 FileHandle = S_IREAD;
              ^
test.c:9:14: note: each undeclared identifier is reported only once for each function it appears in
test.c:11:14: error: ‘S_IWRITE’ undeclared (first use in this function)
 FileHandle = S_IWRITE;
              ^
```

However, the toy example compiles fine if I remove the c99 option. 

I'm now attempting to build the pip wheel using the following command (stripped off the extra arguments that previous users indicated would prevent certain error messages):

```
$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --verbose_failures //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```

I'll post an update tomorrow.
